item.name: 10 Days in Europe
item.comment:
Played this with my Mom over Thanksgiving 2005 and we both thought it was very interesting. Don't let the game fool you. It's a thinking game and an excellent brain burner (at least for us).
I've played this several times after with different people and it's usually a pretty big hit.

item.name: 1960: The Making of the President
item.comment:
Played this for the first time with my wife. We didn't know too much what to expect for the first game and it looked a little complicated to the both of us but it turned out great. Both of us enjoyed the game quite a bit and liked seeing how it all turned it.
One of the things I liked about the game was deciding how to spend your turns and where you'd campaign and what states you'd focus on. Getting endorsements helped me win a lot of the states in the South during the last turn by just removing my wife's support from them. Another thing we liked was how card's could be played multiple ways and how you had to decide how to play it and when. It was especially nervous when playing a card that could help your opponent and hoping they don't activate the card.

item.name: The Adventurers: The Temple of Chac
Agricola
item.comment: Agricola well deserves all the talk it gets and its high rating here on BGG. The game fascinates me and I love how different strategies come out depending on what cards you use. And I love how many cards there are! Each game feels different. I just wish there were more cards to use in a two-player game.

item.name: Agricola Z-Deck
item.comment: Nice little expansion to have but it's not one that we use all that often. It's small so you have to combine it with the other decks.

item.name: Agricola: All Creatures Big and Small
Agricola: All Creatures Big and Small - More Buildings Big and Small
Alhambra
item.comment:
I had a lot of fun with this game. It seems to be a great mix of tile laying, money managment, and strategy. You have to keep track of a lot of things. Matt is tought to beat as well!
The quality of this game is great too. The art is very nice, the tiles are very thick and have a good feel to them, and the game otherwise looks great!

item.name: Alhambra: The Vizier's Favor
item.comment:
I thought this was great. I love expansions and I loved finding out that this expansion had four mini-expansions in them. I like how you can pick and choose which ones you want to use and how they are small and easy to understand but add some interesting twists to the game.
The quality of the pieces is again supurb!

item.name: Amun-Re
item.comment:
Game plays well. The bidding to win the different properties is interesting but can be frustrating for some players in our group.
My mom could not stand this game and just couldn't catch on to how the whole game played. She's usually pretty good at complex games but this one was not for her.

item.name: Antike
item.comment: Finally got it! It does look fun. Just need to play now.

item.name: Apples to Apples
item.comment: A lot of people like this game but it kind of bugs me. It plays more like an activity to me than a game. People sit around and talk and then occasionally throw down a card like "Pig" to answer the question of "Delicate" and it wins. Not my kind of game but it's the easiest to get played when I have groups of 8 or more people and all the non-gamers seem to love it. I play it a lot in my Ward and FHE.

item.name: Aquarius
item.comment:
Artwork on the cards is very pretty and fun to look at. And that's why I got the game.
The game, itself, is really nothing too special. Just kind of like Dominos but still it's fun.

item.name: Arbos
item.comment:
Nice little dexterity game but can be hard. I like playing it without the cards.
The look and feel of the game is what really won me over on it. It's a unique idea and pretty to look at. The game itself isn't really that different from other dexterity games.

item.name: The Ark of the Covenant
item.comment: Nice version of Carcassonne. Plays simple and is easy to teach but still has a lot of fun built into it. Better than vanilla Carcassonne. Good intro to the series.

item.name: Attika
item.comment: Very fun game with two. I like how the game allows you to build up buildings to build all at once or how you can build buildings for free if they are played right. Another interesting idea is the resources on the board and how they are used up when built on.

item.name: Balloon Cup
item.comment: One of my favorite two-player games. It helps that it's about balloons and I'm from New Mexico. I play with the variant that you can't play on the other side until your own side is full. It seems to make the game much more interesting and challanging. Highly recommended.

item.name: Bang!
item.comment:
Awesome game. I pull it out when we have a large group and am looking for something fun and light to play. It's a pretty simple game but one that a lot of people get caught up in to.
The enjoyable aspects of the game are figuring out who to shoot and who not to.

item.name: Bang! Dodge City
item.comment:
I love the expansion for two reasons. It gives you a ton of new character cards and cards to play with 8 which is a blast. I, however, do not like playing the game with the other extra cards included. The green cards while a neat idea just add so much defensive elements to the game that less shooting and killing goes around.
I'd still highly recommend the game to anyone that plays and loves Bang simply for the character cards and 8 player option.

item.name: Barbie and the Magic of Pegasus
Barbie Queen of the Prom Game
Battle Line
item.comment: This is a fun little game. I already have very good memories of it after playing three or four games with my Mom in the airport. I like the numbers behind it and the complex strategy and thinking required.

item.name: BattleLore
item.comment: Pretty good so far. I've only played the medieval battles so far and expect my rating to go up after playing some of the lore battles. It's a very simple game to teach which makes it a good game to pull out yet has some nice depth to it for hours of fun. Looking forward to playing it some more.

item.name: BattleLore: The Hundred Years' War â€“ Crossbows & Polearms
Bharg
item.comment:
Very nice two-player game. My wife and I enjoy it quite a bit. It plays kind of like rummy in which you need to gather specific suits into sets. You simply draw a card on your turn and then discard. You win if all your cards are in suit sets when you discard.
The interesting thing about it is working with the six suits, the multiple suits on the card, and the random suit determined by the discarded ace that always counts as in a set.
The most confusing part of the game is trying to figure out what suits you're missing. We recommend having the cheat sheet that lists all the cards and the suits they have so you don't end up spending the whole game trying to get a card that doesn't exist.

item.name: Blokus
item.comment:
Whoever thought of this game? What a great idea! I can easily trick people into playing this game because they think it's like tetris and when they've figured out that it really has nothing to do with tetris, it's already too late. They love it already and don't care.
A great game! I tend to play more Gemblo now because it allows up to six players.

item.name: Blokus 3D
item.comment: I got this because me and my Mom like Blokus so much. It seemed to be the same thing but in 3d. While a fun game, I think I prefer Blokus much more.

item.name: Blokus Duo
item.comment:
Very, very good game. I bought it for my latest trip to Nauvoo and to play with my friend Heather. I thought she'd enjoy it knowing the other games we've played together. She has a good mind for these type of games. And, of course, I love Blokus as well. I'm usually playing two-player games so this was a great buy for me as it plays much better than two-player than normal Blokus.
I will usually give this as a gift to my friends that get married. Excellent game for couples.

item.name: Blue Moon
item.comment:
A lot funner than I thought it would be. The theme of the game turned me off a little at first but after playing it, it really is just a number game and knowing how to play your cards right.
I've enjoyed it thus far and I like having the different decks to choose from.
Nice, fun, two-player game.

item.name: Bohnanza
item.comment: Fun little game that has a lot more table talk and arguing than I thought. It makes the game a lot more fun though but also take a lot longer. Can make someone feel picked on if people keep voting for them. My sister had that problem the first game and left feeling a little upset.

item.name: Ca$h 'n Gun$
item.comment: Only played once so far. I liked the idea of it but my sister was turned off with the shooting. Felt similar to Bang. Need to try it again.

item.name: Can't Stop
item.comment: Fun little game of taking risks. The game is just simple dice rolling but it gets pretty addictive and you want to keep pushing your luck to see how high up you can get.

item.name: Canasta Caliente
item.comment: Bought this for my mom and got a version for me. She played it with my Sister and Brother-in-law and had a blast doing it. The game was nothing too special for me. I'd rather play some Mystery Rummy instead.

item.name: Captain Moroni's Spy Game
item.comment:
Plays a little like Werewolf. Each player gets passed a card that has either a Lamanite on it or a Nephi Spy. If you're a Nephi Spy, you're trying to put all the Lamanites to sleep by winking at them and win the game if you are successful.
During your turn, you can guess who the Nephite Spy is and if you're right, the Lamanites win.

item.name: Carcassonne
item.comment:
This is one of the very first Eurogames I got on my own after Settlers. I liked the idea of creating the game from tiles and having to connect those tiles together. Reminded me of a game I played as kid called Roads, Rivers, and Railroads but this game actually seemed to have a purpose.
Highly recommended game and very fun. It's what got me going down the road of board gaming even further.

item.name: Carcassonne - The Cathars
item.comment:
A Carcassonne expansion? I had to get this! :)
I paid way too much money to get just the Carcassonne Almnac which I can't really read because it's in German but at least it came with this limited expansion!

item.name: Carcassonne: Hunters and Gatherers
item.comment: Another great Carcassonne game. I like to switch to this every once and a while for a simple game. However, I enjoy the original Carcassonne so much more as it seems to be less focused on rivers and more on cities.

item.name: Carcassonne: Inns & Cathedrals
item.comment:
Good game. I can't imagine playing Carcassonne without it. It's always a little fun to play a Cathedral in someone's huge city and then make it impossible for them to complete.
The big meeple is an excellent addition and adds a lot of fun and better ways to take a city or other feature over from someone. The new color for another player is also a great add.

item.name: Carcassonne: King & Scout
item.comment: I've played this a few times. It adds some excitement to the game as you are now trying to finish up big cities and roads to win the thief and king and score some huge points for yourself. However, it can totally dominate the game as well.

item.name: Carcassonne: The Castle
item.comment: Haven't really played this game too much to tell if I like it or not. Tried it once with my Mom and it kind of irked me that you could place tiles wherever you wanted but I can see that the game has potential to be lots of fun. I just need more play time with it.

item.name: Carcassonne: The City
item.comment: Very fun game. I like how much the walls add to it. I tend to enjoy playing this game more with the original Carcassonne rules of tile placing and it doesn't seem to effect how the game plays.

item.name: Carcassonne: The Princess & the Dragon
item.comment: Can't say that I think the Dragon is as much fun as the other Carcassonne expansions. I like the idea but I usually am playing with two people or am introducing the game to people so I don't use it all that often.

item.name: Carcassonne: The River
item.comment: I never play Carcassonne without this. I think it gives the game a good start and I am looking forward to playing the game with The River 2.

item.name: Carcassonne: The River II
item.comment: Got it in the mail and just need to try it out now.

item.name: Carcassonne: Traders & Builders
item.comment: Another great expansion to Carcassonne and I can't imagine playing the game without it. The builder adds some unique strategy and you know how reasons to finish other people's cities.

item.name: Castle
item.comment: Nothing too special. It seemed that the game could have gone on forever if my wife had played the game right and kept returning cards to my hand. It was a good way to spend the time but I don't think I would buy it if I tried it first nor pick to play it above my other games.

item.name: CATAN 3D Collector's Edition
item.comment:
This game is beautiful and makes playing Settlers a-whole-nother experience. It combines two of my favorite expansions for Settlers and I'm loving every minute of it.
Yes, it costs a lot but for one of my favorite, all-time games, I considered it worth it.
I rate this lower than the other Settlers as it doesn't allow you to play with more than 4 and is missing the seafarer expansion.

item.name: Catan Card Game
item.comment:
Being able to play Settlers with two is wonderful. The cards make the game very easy to transport with you on vacations and go at it. The mechanics worked very well for me.
My sister had this to say about the game, "This game feels more like Catan than Settlers." Hah! I laughed at her for ages for that. She meant to say "than Carcassonne" and for some reason thought it was the Carcassonne card game.

item.name: Catan Card Game Expansion Set
item.comment: Played with the Wizards and Dragons Expansion. It seemed to distract from the main game and shift your attention elsewhere while not adding much. Neat idea though and am willing to give the other expansions a try.

item.name: Catan: Cities & Knights
item.comment:
I think this is a great addition to Settlers of Catan even though it does change it to a bit of a different game.
Some of my favorite things about it is that it adds in a lot of new cards and I feel a much better way to get these cards. I feel that the cards are actually worth it and are actually used as opposed to the original Settlers. Also the Viking attack keeps things interesting and the knights can be used for some fun blockage.

item.name: Catan: Cities & Knights - 5-6 Player Extension
item.comment: See Cities and Knights. Rated lower as it only adds pieces for two more players. Why couldn't they just had these meeples in there to begin with?

item.name: Catan: Event Cards
item.comment: I much prefer rolling dice to drawing cards. It's more suspenseful and adds more to a feel of control (even if that control us luck).

item.name: Catan: Seafarers
item.comment:
Again, I think this is a wonderful expansion for Settlers. It doesn't change the game all that much, gives you a reason to have wool, and gives you some very interesting maps to ply.
I don't feel too bad including this expansion with my first-time players because it really is the same game.

item.name: Catan: Seafarers - 5-6 Player Extension
item.comment: See Seafarers. Rated lower as it only adds pieces for two more players. Why couldn't they just had these meeples in there to begin with?

item.name: Catch Phrase!
item.comment: The new electronic version of the game was surprisingly a lot of fun when played with the right people. I didn't mind the game as much as I remembered I did.

item.name: Category 5
item.comment: Category Five has a fun little theme to it but I wasn't too impressed with the game itself the first time I played it. Will try again with more people.

item.name: Caylus
item.comment:
Game can be very confusing at first and hard to understand. There is a lot going on and it's a hard game to teach to people that don't play games much. However, once the game gets going it starts making sense and moves faster. Need to play it a few more times before giving it my final rating and comments.
I'm having a hard time getting people to play this a game because of it's difficultly and am a little relucantant to try it again myself.

item.name: Chopstick Dexterity MegaChallenge 3000
item.comment: Kind of a neat game idea but one that you feel you could easily make at home using your own stuff. The idea is worth the money though and the game can be lots of fun even if everybody is good with chopsticks.

item.name: Chrononauts
item.comment:
Very interesting idea. I like the game but none of the missions seem to make too much sense nor do the bios.
It all seems to be about drawing the right cards. The game can be hard to get started because you don't have those cards and then impossible as the events you've done are then undone by others and you have to wait for the discard deck to be reshuffled.

item.name: Citadels
item.comment:
Great game. I need to remember to pull this one out more in large groups. I love the concept of picking characters out each turn each with their own unqiue abilities.
I've ordered the new small-box edition of the game in hopes to get it more play and for the better cards.

item.name: Citadels: The Dark City
item.comment: I wasn't sure to count myself owning this game or not as it came with my copy of citadels. I haven't played too much with it but we do use the Wizard and Abbot from the expansion as they seem to round things out. Cards are just there it seems to add flavor to the mix.

item.name: Cleopatra and the Society of Architects
item.comment: Game takes up a lot of room on the table but looks pretty nice and people get excited when they see all the bits. It's a pretty simple game. You either draw cards or build. What makes the game interesting is the corruption amulets. Whoever has the most corruption amulets at the end of the game automatically loses even if they had the most points. Most beginning players will try to stay away from getting any corruption what-so-ever. The usually end up losing. You have to carefully balance using corruption to your best advantage while not getting too much of it.

item.name: Cloud 9
item.comment:
I got this on a whim to play with my Family over Thanksgiving. I enjoyed Diamant a lot and this game seemed similar so I thought it'd be good.
We played it and really enjoyed it quite a bit. My brother, who usually doesn't like games this light or silly themed said he actually enjoyed more than he thought he would.

item.name: Coloretto
item.comment: What an extremelly fun family game. I can quickly see this gaining a huge amount of popularity in our family gatherings. The rules are simple and quick to explain yet the game is a lot of fun and easy to get pulled into. Everyone has a blast playing this every time.

item.name: Commands & Colors: Ancients
item.comment: I played this for the first time after playing BattleLore and right now, I'm thinking that I like BattleLore a little bit more.

item.name: Commands & Colors: Ancients Expansion Pack #1: Greece & Eastern Kingdoms
Commands & Colors: Ancients Expansion Pack #2: Rome and the Barbarians
Commands & Colors: Ancients Expansion Pack #3: The Roman Civil Wars
Compatibility
item.comment: I tend to pull this out for a group date but haven't in a while. I like the cards in the older version however. My last date would always just pick the monkey card and expect me to do the same each time just so we could win. Blah.

item.name: The Construction Game
item.comment: Just like the Farming Game. My Brother-in-law loves this game so we got this one too. It's the same game though if you ask me!

item.name: The Count of Carcassonne
item.comment: I haven't got to play this too much but I think it will make a good mix with the King and Scout Expansion and it seems to be a very interesting game. It will make Carcassonne a little more dirty for sure!

item.name: Cowboys: The Way of the Gun
Cranium
item.comment: Fun game but one that doesn't see me playing it much because I dread the green cards. If it wasn't for the darn green cards and me not knowing anything they mention, I'd play it a lot more often.

item.name: Cranium Pop 5
item.comment: Kind of like Cranium but without the board. You just do the cards. Some of the pop culture though I was unfamiliar with but that's to be expected.

item.name: Cranium Whoonu
item.comment:
Bought this game to play with my family and my new wife so we could get to know each other better--or rather just random stuff about each other. Kind of a fun way to do it.
The game is rather simple though. It plays like Apples-to-Apples but instead of the green card, you are using one of the people playing. You can play either what they would like best or what they would hate most.

item.name: The Curse of the Ruby Rhino
Dancing Eggs
item.comment: Funny, funny game and very unique. You need to be in kind of a silly, light mode to play the game but once you are in that mode the game is a blast and has lots of laughs.

item.name: Der Untergang von Pompeji
item.comment:
Hah, what a fun game. Any game that allows you to throw people into a volcano and recommends that you make noises while doing so is an excellent game in my book! It's made up of two phases that each play as a unique game. In the first phase you put people into the city by playing cards. The second phase comes when the volcano errupts. The game switches over to a tiling laying game of lava. If the lava covers a space with people in it, into the volcano they go!
Excellent, fun, family game.

privateinfo.privatecomment: Bought with the money I earned setting up the Aldura Network for Mom's POS.

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition)
Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) - Labyrinth of Ruin
Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) - Lair of the Wyrm
Descent: Journeys in the Dark: Quest Compendium: Volume One
Descent: The Road to Legend

privateinfo.privatecomment: Shyla picked this up today for me after begging listening to me beg all week for it. It decided to use the money she had set aside for Knucklebones subscription she got me for my anniversary to get it. Only problem? Now I need the other expansions.

item.comment: A must have if you have Descent and a good group that will actually play with you for months on end to finish it. Completely changes the game and takes it to a whole new level. Love it and the idea behind it.

privateinfo.privatecomment: I begged my wife for this today and she gave in just so I would shut up about it. I should probably do something nice for her and not be so annoying about board games for a while.

item.name: Diamant
item.comment:
I think this game is a blast. There really isn't too much to it. You either go deeper in the cave or you don't but the risks involved and the excitment that comes on making the right choice or despair at being too greedy is just great!
A great game to play in a large group and easy for non-gamers to pick up on.

item.name: Domaine
item.comment: I bought this game for one of my brothers for Christmas. They left it at the house after they moved so I figure it's mine. Neither of us have played it yet. I just punched it today, two years after buying it.

item.name: Dominant Species: The Card Game (Promo Card Set)
Dragon's Gold
item.comment:
Would like to try again. I think the first play we were all trying to figure out what was good and what was okay to give up.
Seems to be one that could be fun once everyone understands what's good to get and what isn't. I like how you have to make a deal and you cannot make that deal with anything not in the current horde being divided up.

item.name: Dragonland
item.comment:
Excellent, excellent game. I was worried about getting it because of the theme and wondering if it was too kiddish. But this game is great.
I enjoy controlling the concept of the three color pieces and having to use all of them to pick up different gems and complete your sets. Lots of fun with two.

item.name: Dread Pirate
item.comment:
This game wasn't great. It was mostly just rolling dice and getting lucky. Anything you want to do and I mean anything is done with a dice roll. The only thing that matters is rolling high. There's no skill in the game other than luck.
The bits are nice and the game looks pretty but if all you did was roll once at the start and whoever rolled the highest won the game, you'd have pretty much the same game than if you played the whole thing.

item.name: DruidenWalzer
item.comment:
The artwork is beautiful but the way movement works can be very confusing--especially if you're mind is like mine and doesn't understand clockwise and counter-clockwise very well, let alone upside down when your opponent plays a card!
I have to be in the right mood to play this game.

item.name: Duel in the Dark
item.comment: I had heard a lot about this game and got it on those recommendations. It may just be the theme but the game did nothing for me and I have a hard time teaching it. There's so many ways to get points and lose points and so many different pieces that make you lose points and gain points in different ways. Just kind of confusing.

item.name: Duel of Ages Set 3: Vast Horizons
Duel of Ages Set 4: Royal Tournament
Duel of Ages Set 5: Mercenary Camp
Duel of Ages Set 6: Field of Honor
Duel of Ages Set 7: Ruins of Cany XII
Duel of Ages: Scrye Add-On Pack
Dungeon Twister
item.comment: Love the theme, love the strategy, and love how many expansions for it. The wife? She's not so much into it but I love the game and the ideas.

item.name: Dungeon Twister: Ã€ Feu et Ã€ Sang
Dutch Blitz
item.comment: This is the all-time favorite game of my family. Every family reunion, we play. We play in teams and with two decks. The game is usually pretty intense and we play several rounds together. It's an excellent game for gamers and non-gamers to play together.

item.name: DVONN
item.comment: Game is fun. I always get excited about cutting people off from the red pieces. It's fun to surprise my sister or watch her accidently kill her own pieces off. Hah, fun game.

item.name: eBay Electronic Talking Auction Game
item.comment: Actually a lot of fun for a party game. The talking machine keeps the game going fast and you have to think quick on what you want to bid on and how. There's some strategy in watching what items have gone out and knowing if you've got a low or high card of the same item so you know how to bid. Getting collections seems to be a must in order to win.

item.name: Elfengold
item.comment:
Elfengold is a must have for anybody that enjoys Elfenland. It changes the games and adds so much more to it. I love auctioning off the tiles and the addition of the wizard cards. It allows for more strategy and for a fiercer game.
It is, however, expensive.

item.name: Elfenland
item.comment: The game has a beautiful board and artwork and a pleasent theme. I've only played the game with the Elfengold expansion and can't imagine playing without it. It seems like a friendly game but can get very cutthroat. It feels well thought out and I enjoyed planning my route to visit the most cities and end in my hometown.

item.name: Elk Fest
item.comment:
Haha, oh this game is sooo funny. It's a nice light game and I love mooses. It probably wouldn't be as fun if you were a serious kind of gamer and didn't enjoy stupid things like trying to get your moose across a river by flicking stones.
But me and my sister loved it. We were cracking up and laughing at the mooses when they fell in the water or we flicked a stone way too far.
Not to be played serious. Just for fun and laughs.

item.name: En Garde!
item.comment: Nothing too special about this game. Just about getting the right cards and playing them. Never really caught my interest.

item.name: Escape from Atlantis
item.comment:
This is the 100th game I bought. I got the 1986 Waddingtons version off of eBay.
This game is a blast. I enjoyed playing it though I did change the rules a bit to make the game a little bit more ruthless with a lot of eatting or ship destroying going on.
The game also is a lot more interesting when points are placed on the bottom of your guys to determine the winner rather than simply the amount of people you save.
Allyson and Larkin bought their own copy of the game after playing it with me a few times. We love the carnage!

item.name: Escape: The Curse of the Temple
Evo
item.comment: I bought this game at a Yo-Yo store and it's one of the first games I got in my collection. It reminded me of one my favorite Super Nintendo games of the same name. I wish there were more varity in the types of genes. It's a pretty fun game but could use more war in it.

item.name: The Farming Game
item.comment:
I grew up playing this game with my family. My grandparents owned it and I used to love going to their ranch and playing with all the little pieces. I was a little young then but the memories of it are great.
Unfortunatly, the game isn't as great as my memories now that I've gotten a chance to play it.

item.name: Fearsome Floors
item.comment:
I love the theme to this game! Who can't love something with such cute bits? I mean it's people running away from monsters in a dungeon covered with blood slides!
Fun game but definitely need to keep player's turn short so they can't think too much! Can't wait to play it with lots of people for Halloween or something.

item.name: Fjords
item.comment: Seemed like it could be a fun game since I liked Carcassonne so much and people said it also had some elements of go in it. However, it seems that too many tiles get thrown out to me.

item.name: Flash Point: Fire Rescue - Urban Structures
For Sale
item.comment: This game was a blast. It's a very nice, light game that's a lot of fun and has a cute theme. It's a very easy game to teach and a good game to play with people that aren't into games much. Highly Recommended!

item.name: Formula D: Circuits 2 - Hockenheim and Valencia
Formula D: Circuits 3 - Singapore & The Docks
Formula DÃ©
item.comment:
Wonderful game. I pulled it out for the first day with my normal gaming group and my soon-to-be wife. She loved it. Race cars are just her thing and she thought the game was great.
The game itself plays very well. The dice as gears work well in my opinion. The game gets fun when all of a sudden you have a ton of cars in a corner and you're going at top speed and have to figure out how to get through that turn without blowing up you and everyone else. What a blast!

item.name: Formula DÃ© Circuits 3 & 4 - Zandvoort 2 & SPA-Francorchamps
item.comment: In my opinion, this is the must have expansion map for Formula De as it allows you to make the mega race track when included with the map from the base set. Of course, I'd purchase any expansion map for Formula De but I'm especially glad I have this one.

item.name: Gemblo
item.comment:
A lot busier than Blokus and a little hard to get used to the new movement requirements but it plays with six and is enjoyable. The girls in my group love the shiny jewels.
If you're only playing with 4 or 2 people I'd recommend Blokus or Travel Blokus instead as they are easier to figure out. If you're a Blokus fan and want to play with more people, this game is great.

item.name: Get Bit!
item.comment: Kind of random. Game can drag on a bit if you play with a lot of people and take off the smaller limbs instead of doing bigger chunks.

item.name: GIPF
item.comment: Good thinking game. Takes a little longer than I had thought. It seems to be a slow take one piece from each other game and so can drag out.

item.name: GIPF Project Set 1
item.comment: Christmas

item.name: GIPF Project Set 2
item.comment: Christmas

item.name: Glenn Drover's Empires: The Age of Discovery
Gloom
item.comment: Got for Halloween. Nothing to exciting. Just playing random cards with different point values on them.

item.name: Gloom: Unhappy Homes
item.comment: Got for the fifth player basically. Nothing special here really.

item.name: The Great Dalmuti
item.comment: Need to remember to pull this out in big groups but I'm a little worried about the role-playing aspect of it.

item.name: Gulo Gulo
item.comment:
Okay game. I got it since I heard it played so well with little kids and my sister loves games like that. She teaches first grade and so we both wanted to try it out.
She loves it! She keeps telling me we need to play it some kids.
It's kind of boring when played with adults but I can see myself loving it with some of the little guys.

item.name: Hamsterrolle
item.comment:
Fun little game! I'm having a Nation Games Night Party and got this little baby as a fun game to introduce to people that haven't really played many games. It's quick, easy to learn, and lots of fun. It'll be a big hit.
It's kind of fun to see how the wheel will turn and when pieces will fall.

item.name: Hart an der Grenze
item.comment:
The suitcase tins of this game add so much charm and feel to the game and make it all the more fun to play.
Other than that, it's a simple bluffing game except you can be pretty sure that everybody is lying almost every time. There's really no way to tell who is lying and who isn't. It's a fun, light game that works well for non-serious gamers.

item.name: Le Havre Expansion: Essen Promo Cards
Heave Ho!
item.comment:
My sister, Rachel, really wanted this game. It doesn't really seem to have too much there though if you ask me. It mostly seems to be me playing cards on both sides and messing Rachel up.
Cute cards though and nice rootbeer barrels!

item.name: Hellas
item.comment: Still probably need some time to figure this out. The game played rather quick and I had a lot of questions about what exactly the rules allowed and didn't allow.

item.name: Hera and Zeus
item.comment:
I got this game to have another two-player game to play with Heather. We had been playing the same games lately and I wanted to branch off to some other ones.
I have yet to play it with her but it was a great game. My sister doesn't enjoy it much but I think it's got some neat things to it.
It also lead me to get all the other Kosmos two-player games that I now own.

item.name: HeroQuest
item.comment:
This was one of my favorite games in my youth. I was fascinated by it and had to get every expansion for it. I was surprised to find out how much this was worth when I joined BGG and then even more surprised when my Mom brought up all my old stuff one day and I found I still had this game and all its expansions and they were all in perfect quality. It brought back a lot of memories.
It's an excellent game still and I love it. However, if you don't have memories for it, I'd say go straight for Descent and the expansions for that game. They'll be far more game and depth for you to enjoy there.

item.name: HeroQuest: Return of the Witch Lord
Heroscape Expansion Set: Jandar's Oath
item.comment: The monks by far are my favorite unit from this wave.

item.name: Heroscape Expansion Set: Malliddon's Prophecy
item.comment: I really enjoyed this wave for the bonus glyphs. I wish the other waves would have continued to do this.

item.name: Heroscape Expansion Set: Orm's Return
item.comment: The trees and roads add an amazing amount of detail and beauty to your maps. I can't imagine playing without them. The maps would be just bland without the trees. I would recommmend multiple sets.

item.name: Heroscape Expansion Set: Raknar's Vision
item.comment: Love the big figures. The two dragons are amazing figures and the giant is just fun.

item.name: Heroscape Expansion Set: Road to the Forgotten Forest
Heroscape Expansion Set: Thaelenk Tundra
item.comment:
The land here is much better than the volcano wasteland but its use is still pretty limited. Good mapmaking skills are required to fully put the terrian to good use.
The glaciers are beautiful though and add just as much feel to your maps as the trees do.

item.name: Heroscape Expansion Set: Utgar's Rage
item.comment: Krug was really the only figure that got me excited from this wave.

item.name: Heroscape Expansion Set: Volcarren Wasteland
item.comment:
The lava is really nothing special. It hardly matters when it's in play because everybody knows not to step on it. It just seems like people avoid it. The same effect could be achived if that section of the map was not built. Now if you could thrown people or push them back into the lava, that would be something.
In order to really make use of the lava fields and molten lava tiles, you need good mapmaking skills that force players to deal with them.

item.name: Heroscape Expansion Set: Zanafor's Discovery
item.comment: Have to love the cowboys and the Samurai!

item.name: Heroscape Master Set: Rise of the Valkyrie
item.comment:
Wow. HeroScape is amazing. I never thought a little kid's game could be so much fun. It combines the pleasure of building things with my love for fantasy. It offers a simple combat system with a lot of fun abilities and goals.
The game is beautiful to look at and wonderfully customizable. My complaints about the game is you need a lot of sets to have fun with it and build neat maps and that it can quickly cost a lot of money.

item.name: Hey, That's My Fish!
item.comment: Wonderful, light and quick game to play with four. The rules are easy to teach and the game itself very simple. It screams fun though. Nice game to start a night off with.

item.name: High School Musical 3 Mystery Date Game
Hive
item.comment:
Extremely interesting game!
The placement of pieces and the movement is very interesting. I think what really gets me is how you can strategically move pieces to lock other pieces in. Very, very fun.
Have both the old wood version and the new bakelite version. Game is good enough to own both!

item.name: Imaginiff
item.comment:
A pretty fun game to play with a family or a close group of friends. The game loses some of its fun if you are using names that not everybody knows.
Good game to show you how much you know people or for laughs. Party/Family game.

item.name: Ingenious
item.comment: Good game and very easy to teach. The colors and shapes, in my opinion, soften the game and make seem less threating. The scoring method is interesting because you have to focus on all of the colors and not just a single one. It makes for some interesting juggling in your game play.

item.name: Jamaica
item.comment: The artwork on this game is superb. It will seriously feel like you're playing a board game on a work of art. The game is easy to teach and easy to play but a lot of fun. It makes a good family game and has a fun pirate theme. Highly recommended.

item.name: Jambo
item.comment:
I've played this a few times and have enjoyed it. My sister says it's too cut-throat to her and she doesn't like having to learn all the different cards but I think it's a lot of fun and has some good potential to it.
Need to play it some more.

item.name: Jump the Queue
item.comment: One of my wife's favorite games when she was a kid. Played it at her house when visiting. A simple kid's game that I would say is better than Candy Land but nothing I would want to play with my kids over and over again.

item.name: Kahuna
item.comment:
I enjoy this game and would like to play it some more but my sister had a pretty negative reaction to it. I think it would have some interesting strategy to it if I could play it some more.
However, it does seem to be hard to make a come back in if you mess it up at the start and let the other player buildup a stronghold.

item.name: Key Harvest
item.comment: I got this from one of my Secret Santas here on BGG and was very, very excited to get it. They got me the fancy box version of it. I was thrilled. I would rate this game higher and probably play it more though, if the game pieces were in English. Having to look up what an event does anytime one is drawn makes the game take a little longer and harder for people to understand what they can expect to happen during the game or what they can buy from the town.

item.name: Keythedral
item.comment:
Beautiful looking game! I'm really impressed with how unique the art is on each piece.
The game is all about collecting resources and then spending them correctly. Kind of feels a little like Catan because of that. Enjoyable game.

item.name: Keythedral Expansion
item.comment: Talk about a silly expansion. It's just a few more tiles for a lot more money. Oh well, I'm a sucker for expansions and I do enjoy Keythedral.

item.name: Khet: Eye of Horus Beam Splitter
Khet: The Laser Game
item.comment: Still trying to figure out if I like this one or not. The lasers or cool but so far it seems that everything has just been pretty random and we haven't been able to figure out how to play it strategically.

item.name: Killer Bunnies and the Journey to Jupiter
Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot
Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot GREEN Booster
Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot ORANGE Booster
Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot RED Booster
Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot Twilight WHITE Booster
Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot VIOLET Booster
Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Ominous Onyx Booster
Last Night on Earth: Growing Hunger
Last Night on Earth: The Zombie Game
item.comment:
Perfect game for my Halloween game nights every year. It always hits the table and people love the theme. People like horror movies and like playing a board game that feels like one.
I never seem to win as the zombies though. I must be doing something wrong.

item.name: LEGO X-Pod PlayOff
item.comment:
I think this is a really neat game. It combines LEGOs with chess. You have eight different teams each with their own unique units. I love how cute and creative the different units are and the fun of reasource management. The only problem I have with it as a lot of things have to be printed out from online. I would have preferred professional cards.
I really wish I could play it more.

item.name: Lifeboats
item.comment: Love the wooden pieces for this game. I'm wanting to play this more but am always reluctant to bring it to the table. The first time I played it, my sister got extremely upset because everyone was always voting her off the boats. We weren't doing it on purpose but it got to her. She got up and left in the middle of the game and said she'd never play the game again. And we haven't yet. Maybe some day.

item.name: Ligretto
item.comment: This is the all-time favorite game of my family. Every family reunion, we play. We play in teams and with two decks. The game is usually pretty intense and we play several rounds together. It's an excellent game for gamers and non-gamers to play together.

item.name: Lord of the Rings: The Confrontation
item.comment:
Got around to playing this game finally. It was pretty interesting. There's obviously a lot of strategy going on that I didn't understand. I like how the dark side feels so strong but there's nothing in it that's preventing the light side from winning.
Need to play more for sure.

item.name: Lord of the Rings: The Confrontation (Deluxe Edition)
item.comment:
Good game. Similiar to the normal version but fun to have the extra characters. I'd recommend getting this one instead of the normal version of it for the extra options.
My sister hates this game though and it's a struggle to get her to play it with me.

item.name: Lord of the Rings: The Duel
Lost Cities
item.comment:
A very interseting game. I didn't like it too much at first but the more I play it the more addicting it seems to get. My mom and sister especially seem to enjoy the game.
It seems that people need a little time to catch onto this game and pick up the strategy but once they do, it's a lot of fun.
Highly recommended!

item.name: Louis XIV
item.comment: A bonus present from my Secret Santa. I was expecting to get this and I'm very interested in trying it out. Thanks again, Secret Santa!

item.name: Lupus in Tabula: Lady Werewolf's Revenge
Manila
item.comment:
This game is absolutly beautiful. I bought it simply for the name (I lived in the Philippines for two years) and the high quality bits that it had.
However, I am not disappointed by it. I really get caught up in the betting aspects of the game and have a blast teaching it to people in my Ward on Sunday. Hah! :)

item.name: Marry, Date or Dump?
item.comment: I can see how people might have fun with this game but frankly I don't know any of the people on the cards 80% of the time and so find it pretty boring.

item.name: Master Thieves
item.comment: Played this for the second time with a group of six. The game played much better and was actually quite enjoyable. Everyone loved the box and the opening of closing of drawers. It was interesting to see who would pick what character and start of the strategy seemed to be coming out at the end. The game seems like it'd get even better with more plays.

item.name: Memoir '44
item.comment: Beautiful game and beautiful system. I'm more into the Battlelore theme myself. I'd probably rate this game higher if I was more into WWII and war. I recommend it to all my cousins in the military though and do so without hesitation. There's differently a lot of expansions and support for this game.

item.name: Metro
item.comment: Okay game. Plays a lot like Tsuro which I think I prefer. Tsuro lets you build paths and make other people shot off the board and has chances of collision. This one I felt like I was forced to play tiles a specific way and didn't have as much freedom as I would have liked.

item.name: Mille Bornes
item.comment: I remember having a blast playing this on the computer when I was younger but the game really doesn't seem to be too special anymore. It's just playing cards. It seems one person is getting all the cards they need and the other isn't. Maybe if I played it with four?

item.name: Modern Art
item.comment: Wow, a lot of fun. This by far is my favorite auction game. I love seeing how the paintings sell and trying to figure out how to maximize my money. Plays like a light game but complex enough to keep you very interested.

item.name: Mr. Jack
item.comment: Only played once and need to play again to see if my rating adjusts. Didn't seem anything special to me on the first play and I was easily caught as Mr. Jack. I probably just don't have the skills yet and need to give it some more plays.

item.name: Munchkin
item.comment: This game was really fun when I first got it but now it seems to be getting a little boring. Mostly seems to be luck and the fun seems to come from the inside D&D jokes on the cards. Once you've heard them all, not much left that's fun.

item.name: Munchkin 2: Unnatural Axe
item.comment: See Munchkin comments.

item.name: Munchkin 3: Clerical Errors
item.comment: See Munchkin comments.

item.name: Mystery of the Abbey
item.comment: Pretty fun. I wasn't sure if I was getting more clues from questions or from passing cards but I did feel like some detective works was being done. We ignored the annoying cards like chanting.

item.name: Mystery Rummy: Al Capone and the Chicago Underworld
Mystery Rummy: Jack the Ripper
item.comment: I love the theme, artwork, and feel of the cards. I've been trying to round off my collection with more card games as I have a lot of friends that seem to be more comfortable with those at the start and my mom loves them.

item.name: Mystery Rummy: Murders in the Rue Morgue
Nature of the Beast: City vs. Suburb
Nature of the Beast: Farm vs. Forest
Nexus Ops
item.comment: Fun game. I use this as a gateway game to those that enjoy Risk to show them that there are other good games out there. The mission cards give you something to focus on and ensures the game doesn't carry on to long.

item.name: NHL Ice Breaker: The Card Hockey Board Game
Niagara
item.comment: Still need to play this more to figure it out. It's an interesting concept and people are eager to play it after seeing the moving river. The expansion looks like it'll add some nice flavor.

item.name: O Zoo le Mio
item.comment: Cute game. The theme is what makes this game the most fun for me. The game played good but it seemed to require a lot of work to keep updated and once a player got behind, it was hard for them to catch back up.

item.name: Odin's Ravens
item.comment:
I love a Norse theme! This game has got pretty cards, ravens, and lots of fun.
I love the race! Great two-player game.

item.name: Once Upon a Time: Dark Tales
item.comment: Doubt I'll be playing this anytime soon but I love Once Upon a Time so much and I am hooked to expansions! I wish the cards were a little more darker. I expected at least a werewolf or something. I plan to pull it out at my Halloween Parties.

item.name: Once Upon a Time: The Storytelling Card Game
item.comment:
I heard about this card game from Orson Scott Card. I know a lot of people don't like this game but it's one of my favorite when played with the right group. It's important to remember the goal of the game is to tell a story not to win. You have to be very attentive in listening and remembering all the details. I imagine most people don't like the game because they are not following the rules or focusing on telling a good story. For fun for those that are creative.
I wish I could play this more.

item.name: Order of the Stick Adventure Game: The Dungeon of Dorukan
Palabra
item.comment: I bought this for our family Christmas gathering and game playing but no one in the group seemed interested in it. It must be because we're terrible spellers!

item.name: Pandemic
item.comment: Excellent. Easy to teach and fun to play. People are really interested in the idea of playing together against a board game. The mechanics for the game make this very fun and challenging. The board actually wins most of the time if you aren't careful. Games in which you do win are always very close and just one wrong step could have resulted in you losing.

item.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords - Base Set
Phase 10
item.comment: I'm always behind a few phases and right when I'm about to finish my phase someone else finishes theirs and I have to start all over again getting the cards I need.

item.name: Phoenix
item.comment: Neat, neat game. The colored wooden pieces are what draw me to it the most. It's all about getting the right cards really but it's a fun game to look at and is a great add to my collection.

item.name: Pirate's Cove
item.comment:
I really can't say too much for this game. I was really excited about it and expected it to play really well. It looked so pretty and it was about pirates! It had to be fun, right?
It wasn't what I expected though. My brother and I have come up with a lot of our own rules and cards to make it funnier but it still seems to be missing something.

item.name: Pirates of the Spanish Main
item.comment: I bought this game just so I could put the boats together and maybe use with Plunder

item.name: PitchCar
item.comment:
One of my very few tens and I don't even feel bad about doing this. This is simply a wonderful, fun, fun game. The laughs everyone were having as we played were great.
Here's what I like about it:
1. You can make your own tracks and always be playing something new. 2. It can play a ton of people. 3. The rules are simple and easy to explain. 4. Everybody loves it and has a blast with it.
The game is a little expensive but worth every penny. I'm looking forward to picking up another set.
I own Pitch Car, not Carabande.
Hah, I now own two copies of this game it's so good!

item.name: PitchCar Extension
item.comment:
The Pitch Car Expansion also adds a whole bunch to the game. Almost every single track I make, I'll use the expansion tracks in. They add a lot of flavor.
You get two ramps to make jumps or bridges, some fat to thin curves, and a rainbow straight.
Not a lot of pieces for the price but a whole lot of fun!
Hah, I know own two copies of this game it's so good!

item.name: Plunder
item.comment: The game wasn't as complicated as everyone makes it sound. I read through the rules once and it all seemed pretty clear to me. The game has an excellent theme and supports it very well. However, I'm not sure how much I enjoyed the game. It does seem to be very heavy on luck and take a while to play. If it played faster, I wouldn't mind the luck so much. Our first game took about 2 hours.

item.name: Poison
item.comment: Played for the first time with my linguistics group. They enjoyed the simpleness of the game and its quick play time. It was a pretty decent, light and enjoyable game. Nothing too heavy but enough of a game to keep you interested. Good filler.

item.name: Polarity
item.comment:
This looks to be a game made for magnent lovers! I can play with magnents forever!
Still haven't quite figured out the game yet though. I just seem to be placing magnents done for who knows why or to do what?

item.name: Power Grid
item.comment: Finally got to play Power Grid. I was a lot more fun than any of us expected. My group has always been a little hestiant to play it because the box looks kind of boring and old fashion. It was a success though and we're looking into playing it more. My favorite thing about the game is they sell seperate boards with new maps.

item.name: Power Grid: BGG Promo Card Set
Power Grid: The New Power Plant Cards
Primordial Soup
item.comment:
The game looks like a lot of fun. I like the art a lot. I was surprised though how much more fierce the game was though and how long it took. I was expecting something lite and easy but got a pretty meaty game instead.
I liked seeing how the board changed and how different genes resulted in vastly different tactics by players. Some people were moving around like crazy, others hardly had to eat, while others just ate other players, and the last just didn't care too much about dying because they reproduced like crazy.
I think the game could use another play but it was too long and chaotic for my wife so it may be a while before I can give it another go.

item.name: Prophecy
item.comment:
Neat little board role-playing game. Characters go around the board fighting monsters to gain gold and experience. Gold and experience can be used to buy abilities or items for your character.
I've only played it solo so far but it looks promising and will be playing it for reals soon. I enjoyed the trial run a thousand times more than World of Warcraft: The Boardgame.

item.name: Pueblo
item.comment: Rachel, my sister, got this for my Birthday. Excited to try it out.

item.name: Puerto Rico
item.comment:
Played this for my first real time over Christmas. The girls in the family were a little confused by it but after a few rounds they caught on quick.
I enjoyed the game and want to try it out again to really figure it out. My mom asked to play it again the very next day.

item.name: Puerto Rico Expansion
item.comment: You know me... I have to have all the expansions! :)

item.name: PÃœNCT
item.comment: Okay game. The game seems hard to get your pieces onto the map in the right position to be useful. I've only played a few times though and know that I'm missing out on some of the strategy. Not sure if I want to invest the time into the game though to figure it out. Didn't grab me as Yinsh and Dvonn did.

item.name: Queen's Necklace
item.comment: Still haven't quite figured out this game. I always think I know what I'm doing but I always end up losing it. I'm just always selling my gems for nothing since I sell too many at a time but when I sell less, I don't sell enough and someone else gets the buy!

privateinfo.privatecomment: Bought with the money I earned setting up the Aldura Network for Mom's POS.

item.name: Race for the Galaxy: Rebel vs Imperium
Race for the Galaxy: The Gathering Storm
Reef Encounter
item.comment:
A difficult game to understand through the rules. They make the game seem complicated but it's actually very easy to play and understand once you get going.
We didn't do too well though and Larkin ran away with the game while we all ended up about 20 points behind. It was hard to get the colors you needed to do the moves you wanted.

item.name: Reef Encounter of the Second Kind
Risk
item.comment:
I'd probably rate this game higher if I didn't always lose and this game didn't always take so long!
This game reminds me of dorm life my freshmen year of college.

item.name: Risk 2210 A.D.
item.comment: Just like Risk but with a little more flavor. For some reason, I always end up stuck on the moon with no bases on the ground. I own the moon though!

item.name: Risk: The Lord of the Rings
item.comment:
I play this every Christmas with my Family and my sweet little Mother always ends up winning!
She tricks us, she does!
Takes forever to play and I'm much more interested in other games now.

item.name: Roads & Boats
item.comment:
I've only played this solo so far but I can tell already that this is my kind of game. It's just grabs me to have all these resources that I have to use to transform into different items and factories which can then be used for other things, etc.
In a way, it reminds me of a toy I had as a kid where a dumptruck would pick up black balls, travel down a road, dump them for the next truck, and then the next truck would then pick up the balls, dump them back into the dumptruck, who would then go up the hill and dump them into a container for the original dumptruck to pick up again! That toy was amazing and that's what this game reminds me of and it gets me very, very excited.
I also like the control it requires in your transportation networks.

item.name: RoboRally
item.comment:
Game took much longer than I expected. I liked the programming aspect of it and figuring out how my moves would influence others or just trying to harass the other robots.
Not a game for everyone though.

item.name: Roll Through the Ages: The Bronze Age
Roll Through the Ages: The Late Bronze Age
Samurai
item.comment:
An absolutly wonderful game! Very simple to explain and play but very complex strategy to it. I don't think I'll ever get tired of this game.
Looks very pretty and simplistic too. Very, very nice game.

item.name: San Juan
item.comment:
Lots and lots of fun. This game is a lot simplier to teach and explain than Puerto Rico but I feel has a lot of the same elements that make the original game a blast. I like being able to play it with two-people.
Puerto Rico is still a fun game and I like the complexity of it and all but when I'm looking for a short, lighter version of it, I'll play this.
More recently I have played this with four and found the game to be even that much more enjoyable! It was simple to teach and after one game everyone caught on to the different buildings and how to play and wanted to try again. They were hooked.

item.name: Scene It? Disney
item.comment: Good to play with Disney freaks I guess. I know some Disney and can do well in the game. It's a good game to play when you're both sick in bed.

item.name: Sequence
item.comment: An excellent fun game and a big hit with my friend, Heather. She loves playing it and again we'll play pretty nasty with each other.

item.name: SET
item.comment: I'd probably like this game more if I didn't always get my butt kicked by my sister. I never seem to be able to find a set until someone yells set. I was just about to yell set for that one myself!

item.name: The Settlers of Catan: 5-6 Player Extension
item.comment: See Settlers. Rated lower as it only adds pieces for two more players. Why couldn't they just had these meeples in there to begin with?

item.name: The Settlers of Catan: The Fishermen of Catan
item.comment: Just got it in my Spielbox. Looking forward to trying it out.

item.name: The Settlers of Catan: The Great River
item.comment: Err, doesn't look like much if you ask me. I'll probably use it with rules of my own to make it more interesting.

item.name: The Settlers of Zarahemla
item.comment: A very beautiful, well-designed Settlers of Catan variant. The board is very nice and the temple building a fun addition. The LDS theme is helpful in easing in other LDS people. The only reason this game doesn't see more play or gets a higher rating is it doesn't allow for the Catan Expansions and only plays up to four people.

item.name: Shadows over Camelot
item.comment:
This game has surprisngly gotten a lot more play than I thought it would in our group. Larkin loves it and often asks to play. His wife puts up with it but is an excellent player. The tension in the game is always tight.
I always seem to be the traitor.

item.name: Shear Panic
item.comment: Just ordered. I probably paid too much but I love sheep!

item.name: Shipwrecked
item.comment: Fun little bidding game. The cards are really cute but the rules seem to be confusing to explain. Plays too fast in my opinion. As soon as it gets going, it's over.

item.name: Shut the Box
item.comment: Not the most entertaining game. Just rolling dice and hoping to get the right numbers. You don't need a fancy box to do this. Just get some paper and write the numbers down and scratch them off as you roll them. I wouldn't consider it a game--more of a way to waste your time with dice.

item.name: Sid Meier's Civilization: The Board Game
Slamwich
item.comment: This game isn't anything too special for adults. Just another slap jack game that can seem to go on forever as you swap cards back and forth and try to beat someone in a game of war. My sister said she liked it though and mentioned that it would be a good game for the 1st graders she teaches as it helps with patterns and memory.

item.name: Snow Tails: The Leap of Death
Split Second
item.comment: This game is a blast. Nice, fun party game. Questions are asked and players have to quickly write down their answers and slap their answer onto the pile. Whoever has the closest answer and was furthest down on the pile gets a point.

item.name: Squint
item.comment: The OCD in me gets me in this game. I can't stand having the pieces overlapping and covering up the other. But you have to do this to make some of the pictures! Ahh!

item.name: Start Player: A Kinda Collectible Card Game
Strive For Five: Book of Mormon
item.comment: Scripture trivia game. Pretty bland and boring but it has different levels for different age groups.

item.name: Summoner Wars: Phoenix Elves vs Tundra Orcs
Survive: Escape from Atlantis! 5-6 Player Mini Expansion
Survive: Escape from Atlantis! The Giant Squid Mini Extension
Take Off!
item.comment:
If you like games with random luck, random movement, and the ability to be bumped clear back to the start after having spent forever to get where you are, then this is your game.
My wife's family grew up playing it though and they like it. It's at least good for learning names of a whole bunch of cities throughout the entire world.

item.name: Tally Ho!
item.comment: A fun, light game. It feels a little like chess. Moves can be very strategic but there is a little bit of luck involved as well in flipping over tiles.

item.name: TAMSK
item.comment:
The time element in this game is interesting but didn't seem to play much of a role. My sister and I quickly figured out how to get the pieces moved so that the timers would never run out.
The game is still pretty fun though. You really feel like you have to move and act fast.

item.name: Through the Ages: A Story of Civilization
Through the Desert
item.comment:
The idea behind the game is interesting. Each player has a group of camels and you have to carefully construct camel chains to reach waterholes and oasises.
The game can get pretty busy with lots of players and your routes will get cut off quick. You have to watch and make sure you can get where you need to get.
It's a fun game with cute, colorful camel pieces. That's one of the fun thigns for me about the game.
We usually play with the waterholes turned upside down to hide their value and add a little luck to the game.

item.name: Thurn and Taxis
item.comment: Wonderful game. A lot of people compare it to Ticket to Ride but I feel the games are different enough and involve different strategies. Though if you do enjoy Ticket to Ride you'll probably enjoy this just as much.

item.name: Thurn and Taxis: All Roads Lead to Rome
Thurn and Taxis: Power and Glory
Ticket to Ride
item.comment:
Picked it up since we had all the other Ticket to Ride games and wanted to complete our collection. It doesn't see much play in our house though. We played and tried it but it seemed bland without tunnels and nothing really unique to it like the other boards we played. Of course, this game came out first.
It's still a good game but I would have rather just bought the board and not the entire game again.

item.name: Ticket to Ride Map Collection: Volume 1 - Team Asia & Legendary Asia
Ticket to Ride Map Collection: Volume 2 - India & Switzerland
Ticket to Ride Map Collection: Volume 3 - The Heart of Africa
Ticket to Ride: Europe
item.comment:
Game is good at first but gets a little boring after repeat plays. Of course, my gaming group has insisted on playing it every week for the last two months. That might have something to do with it. I've moved its rating down for sure because of that.
The game can be fun but most of the time, you're working on your own routes and collecting cards. There's not much interaction between the players.

item.name: Ticket to Ride: MÃ¤rklin
item.comment:
This is probably my favorite version of Ticket to Ride. I started off playing Ticket to Ride: Europe but enjoy this one more as it's lacking the train stations and the game feels more cut throat. The passengers also allow for some unique scoring and add some fun surprises to the overall game. They can be very powerful.
I also enjoy the artwork in the game and the uniqueness of each train card.

item.name: Ticket to Ride: Mystery Train Expansion
Ticket to Ride: Nordic Countries
item.comment: In my opinion, this is the best map for a two-player game. The map is tight and you are sure to get blocked and it'll be impossible to finish some of your tickets. This keeps the game challenging and won't feel like your playing by yourself like in USA or Europe if played two-player.

item.name: Ticket to Ride: Switzerland
item.comment: An excellent fun map to play on for me and the wife. It's gotten my wife addicted to the game and she requests to play almost two-three times a night. I like the tight feel of the map and being able to connect to tickets off the map and having some options as to where to go with some of the tickets. Highly recommended.

item.name: Ticket to Ride: The Card Game
Ticket to Ride: The Dice Expansion
Ticket to Ride: USA 1910
item.comment: This is a must have expansion if you have Ticket To Ride. The big cards are so much better and the destination tickets give you so many options.

item.name: Tigris & Euphrates
item.comment: Finally got to try this over Christmas. I played it on a trial run with my brother and it seems pretty good. Looking to try it again before a final opinion is given.

item.name: Timberland
item.comment: The game itself is beautiful to look at and that's one of the reason I purchased it. I love the tree meeples and the artwork. However, the game itself seems a bit random. You can play cards to control things a little but with a lot of players, there is so much going on each Winter or Treecutter phase that it's hard to strategize.

item.name: Torres
item.comment:
Looks to be a great game from my trial run of it. Very intesting strategy and thinking going on.
Will have to play with real people later on and update my comments.

item.name: A Touch of Evil: Something Wicked Expansion
A Touch of Evil: The Supernatural Game

privateinfo.privatecomment: Got for Halloween Board Game Night.

item.name: Trias
item.comment:
I just got the game for the Dinosaur Meeples. I was kind of disappointed when I found out that the meeples I saw were custom made ones but luckly Jeffrey was willing to sell me some of his!
This is a great, fun, unique game and I'm excited to introduce it to my family over the break.
If you like games like Carcassonne, you'll like this game too. Especially since it has dinosaurs!

item.name: Trivial Pursuit: Disney Edition
item.comment: Nothing special. Just questions about Disney. Some are easy, some are hard. I don't care much for this type of trivia game so didn't enjoy it as much.

item.name: Tsuro
item.comment:
Game is short and quick. Basically tiles are layed down and you following the paths created to their end. It's fun to see how the patterns turn out once they start connecting up. You could think a lot about it each turn I guess but I find it more fun to just enjoy this game as something simple and play the cards as I see them. An okay game but nothing really too special.
The game itself is beautiful and stunning to behold.

item.name: Turn the Tide
item.comment:
Excellent card game that has a simple mechanic to it that actually turns out to be quite a bit of fun.
It's interesting to see how players bid their cards to either get the lower lighthouse or to avoid the highest. It's a hard choice to make what card to bid as you don't want to bid too high but don't want to waste your low cards or you want to bid high but not too high and waste that high card but not too low and get stuck with the worse lighthouse.
Fun times for the family.

item.name: Twilight Struggle
item.comment: If you have choice between this game and 1960: Making of the President, go with 1960: Making of the President. It's a more refined version of this game and plays faster, better, and easier.

item.name: UNO
item.comment: They don't play Uno like normal here in Utah. They play a game I like to call Super Apostate Mormon Uno with all these new, weird rules. Makes it fun though. Of course, it is still just Uno!

item.name: UNO Attack!
item.comment: If you don't mind a light game of Uno, this game is perfect. It puts Uno up a lot in the fun meter. Every time you have to push the Uno attack button, there's a lot of anxiety over how many cards you're going to get and you just hope that it decides to spit out nothing at you. It becomes even more tense when you have to push the button after it's gone on for a while without spitting out any cards. Fun game to play with those that just can't handle a complicated Eurogame at the moment.

item.name: UNO Rummy-Up
item.comment: Good game to play with my Mom. She enjoys Rummy and the Uno aspects of it seem to make it more enjoyable for me.

item.name: UNO: Harry Potter
item.comment: Uno with Harry Potter! How much better can we get? Well, okay, so the cards are ugly and it really is Uno. Not much new here but it's the Uno I play the most.

item.name: Vikings
item.comment:
Only played 2 players so far with the wife but I really enjoyed it. I admit part of what the game that drew me to it was the Viking Meeples but the game is a blast as well. It's got a nice bidding/buying mechanism and control on the different character types.
I like the different viking abilities and have to balance between getting them all.

item.name: VisualEyes
item.comment: An okay game. You have dice with pictures on them and try to form words from the pictures. It annoys me though because it always seems people try to stretch the pictures too much and come up with crazy answers. It leds to more fights than fun in my opinion.

item.name: Wackee SIX
item.comment:
This game is very similar to Dutch Blitz. The game differs in a few points such as allowing for up to six players, cards goes up to 13, and some wild cards are included in each deck. You also have 6 cards in front of you face-up and then a six card draw pile. You have to get rid of all 12 of these cards. In Dutch Blitz, you have four piles one of which has 10 cards in it and you only have to get rid of the 10 pile. The person that goes out gets 10 bonus points. Otherwise it plays the same.
I rate it much lower than Dutch Blitz because of these differences. The game gets slightly more confusing with the higher numbers to be reached. In addition, the wild cards make it very hard to tell what color and number a pile currently is. I found myself having to waste time to review a deck that had a wild on top of it. The 10 bonus points for the winner adds nothing to the game and only pushes the winner further and further ahead. The negative points for losing is penalty enough in my opinion.

item.name: Werewolf
item.comment: This game has grown on me since joining BGG. I used to play this as Mofia in a lot of FHE groups. I thought it was kind of boring there. However, since then I've had the chance to play it with my family and spice the game up a little more with the additional roles. I enjoy it a lot more and can see why so many people enjoy it. Give it a chance again if you've played it only in FHE.

item.name: The Werewolves of Miller's Hollow: New Moon
The Werewolves of Miller's Hollow: Village
Who Said... Book of Mormon Game
item.comment:
Seems to be a pretty well done children's game for Church. The art is cute and the cards are good quality.
Comes with instructions for five different types of game but basically involve matching or guessing who said the scripture.

item.name: Wits & Wagers
item.comment: Nothing too special. Just another trivia game but with betting. Not too big on it as people just guess the answers and want to bet on most of the time. Left me with a feeling that I was just randomly answering questions and then randomly betting the whole time.

item.name: Wizard Kings
item.comment:
Excellent game. I love the war aspect of it but I'm usually turned off by war games because of the theme. For some reason, the fantasy theme to the game made it very appealing to me and so I was wiling to try it out. Definatly one of the first war games I've played and enjoyed.
The customization of the armies was pretty fun and building them up to capture cities is great. Looking forward to playing many more games.

item.name: Wizard Kings - Expansion Armies
item.comment:
The additional armies make this game a lot of fun for me. I went and bite the bullet and bought all the expansion armies at once along with the game.
I don't regret it and love having all the options available to me and being able to play with more than two if I want to.

item.name: Wizard Kings Expansion Maps
item.comment: I think having the maps is a must. The allow you to play some many more different unique games rather than the same thing everytime. The maps all fit nice together with each other and allow for nice customization.

item.name: Wooly Bully
item.comment: Me and my friend, Heather, play this game all the time together. She loves it and it's usually pretty nasty between us in which we always try to mess people up. It's a good gateway game to Carcassonne and a fun game for two.

item.name: World of Warcraft Trading Card Game
World of Warcraft: The Adventure Game
World of Warcraft: The Boardgame
item.comment:
I pre-ordered this game to get the special Night Elf Druid figure. It's a very nice piece and I'm glad I have it. Wish I had them all.
The game, while fun, can drag on a bit. I can see myself really enjoying the game with other people that play WoW and don't mind long games. Otherwise, it's going to be a tough game to get played. I can never see myself playing this with my Euro gaming group.
Great game for World of Warcraft fans. The cards and items really fit into the whole idea. I loved tweaking my character. The combat system is kind of interesting but is mostly just rolling dice. The characters are different though and it is kind of fun to see how they play out and how their dice pools end up. I thought the dice pools accurately reflected the MMORPG characters. Combat is very fiddly though and we found ourselves doing most of it in our head.
If you like World of Warcraft and have a group of friends you can play with, go for it! It'll be a long night of fun. If not, pass on it.

item.name: World of Warcraft: The Boardgame - Shadow of War
item.comment:
Love all the new talents and spells. Makes the training phases a little bit longer since you now have more cards to look at and choices to make. Good addition though.
The blue quest rewards is a good idea and I'm glad they were added. The mage's polymorph spell cheats the idea behind them but I'm sure a fixed will be released for this.
I'm mixed on the destiny cards. They just seemed to add more to worry about and fiddle with. They do add some useful quests and some interesting options sometimes but other times just too cumbersome to deal with.

item.name: Yali
item.comment:
The main selling point of this game is its unique mechanic of using gravity to determine whose turn it is. Only problem is it's hard to get the board to balance just right when setting up and then the board easily becomes bumped off while playing from its original sweet spot giving the other player the advantage.
All the game involves is moving marbles down the board. The instructions even admit that the game can be solved and the same winner win every time if that strategy is used.

item.name: YINSH
item.comment:
The movement in this game is what I like best. I like putting the little circles inside of the rings and then moving the rings.
The rings can also be moved to block your opponent very effectively. You have to be carefully in how you move or you could end up giving the pieces you worked so hard on to the other player with a simple jump on their part.

item.name: ZÃˆRTZ
item.comment: I've played this a few times with my Mom but not enough times to really have it figured out. Need to give it a few more goes before giving it a final judgement.

item.name: Zooloretto
item.comment:
I got this thinking it would be an easier, less abstract version of Coloretto but I find preferring Coloretto more and wishing we were playing that instead of Zooloretto. The animal theme makes it easier to introduce to people though and draws them in more than cards that all look the same except for their color.
I always tell people that when they sell an animal from their barn, the animal is really being processed. That usually greatly decreases how many people take that action. Especially if you keep pointing it out and making them feel bad for even thinking about doing that.

item.name: Zooloretto: Rio Grande Games Expansion Pack #1
Zooloretto: Rio Grande Games Expansion Pack #2
